verses.verse: Shiggaion<WH7692> of David<WH1732>, which he sang<WH7891> unto the LORD<WH3068>, concerning the words<WH1697> of Cush<WH3568> the Benjamite<WH1121><WH1145>. O LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430>, in thee do I put my trust<WH2620>: save<WH3467> me from all them that persecute<WH7291> me, and deliver<WH5337> me:
Lest he tear<WH2963> my soul<WH5315> like a lion<WH738>, rending it in pieces<WH6561>, while there is none to deliver<WH5337>.
O LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430>, if I have done<WH6213> this; if there be<WH3426> iniquity<WH5766> in my hands<WH3709>;
If I have rewarded<WH1580> evil<WH7451> unto him that was at peace<WH7999> with me; (yea, I have delivered<WH2502> him that without cause<WH7387> is mine enemy<WH6887>:)

Let the enemy<WH341> persecute<WH7291> my soul<WH5315>, and take<WH5381> it; yea, let him tread down<WH7429> my life<WH2416> upon the earth<WH776>, and lay<WH7931> mine honour<WH3519> in the dust<WH6083>. Selah<WH5542>.

Arise<WH6965>, O LORD<WH3068>, in thine anger<WH639>, lift up<WH5375> thyself because of the rage<WH5678> of mine enemies<WH6887>: and awake<WH5782> for me to the judgment<WH4941> that thou hast commanded<WH6680>.
So shall the congregation<WH5712> of the people<WH3816> compass thee about<WH5437>: for their sakes therefore return<WH7725> thou on high<WH4791>.
The LORD<WH3068> shall judge<WH1777> the people<WH5971>: judge<WH8199> me, O LORD<WH3068>, according to my righteousness<WH6664>, and according to mine integrity<WH8537> that is in me.

Oh let the wickedness<WH7451> of the wicked<WH7563> come to an end<WH1584>; but establish<WH3559> the just<WH6662>: for the righteous<WH6662> God<WH430> trieth<WH974> the hearts<WH3826> and reins<WH3629>.
My defence<WH4043> is of God<WH430>, which saveth<WH3467> the upright<WH3477> in heart<WH3820>.
God<WH430> judgeth<WH8199> the righteous<WH6662>, and God<WH410> is angry<WH2194> with the wicked every day<WH3117>.
If he turn<WH7725> not, he will whet<WH3913> his sword<WH2719>; he hath bent<WH1869> his bow<WH7198>, and made it ready<WH3559>.
He hath also prepared<WH3559> for him the instruments<WH3627> of death<WH4194>; he ordaineth<WH6466> his arrows<WH2671> against the persecutors<WH1814>.
Behold, he travaileth<WH2254> with iniquity<WH205>, and hath conceived<WH2029> mischief<WH5999>, and brought forth<WH3205> falsehood<WH8267>.
He made<WH3738> a pit<WH953>, and digged<WH2658> it, and is fallen<WH5307> into the ditch<WH7845> which he made<WH6466>.
His mischief<WH5999> shall return<WH7725> upon his own head<WH7218>, and his violent<WH2555> dealing shall come down<WH3381> upon his own pate<WH6936>.
I will praise<WH3034> the LORD<WH3068> according to his righteousness<WH6664>: and will sing praise<WH2167> to the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> most high<WH5945>.
